title: New York Giants logo font
content:
could someone please tell me the font for this logo:

[http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/2/29/Giants\_1976.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150228184624/http:/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/2/29/Giants_1976.gif "http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/2/29/Giants\_1976.gif")

thank you!
author: brettk

comments.content:
Probably custom-drawn. You might want to start with something like [Eurostile Condensed Bold.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150228184624/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/eurostile_condensed_bold/?sample_text=GIANTS&sample_size=96)

- Lex
I second Lex, but I would go with [Eurostile T Heavy Condensed Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150228184624/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/eurostile/t-heavy-condensed-italic/)...

From the [FAQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20150228184624/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq)

**And logos of sports teams?**  
There you have to keep in mind that sports merchandising -- everything from baseball caps to soccer jerseys -- is big business, so the popular sports teams have every reason to make their logo as difficult to imitate as possible. Most of them are custom designed or use heavily customized existing fonts.
